Title.evidence: CALGB 140503: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Sub-lobar Resection to Lobectomy for Stage IA NSCLC

Trial_Design.evidence: multi-center randomised controlled trial evaluating the equivalence of sub-lobar resection and lobectomy for stage IA non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) ≤ 2 cm in diameter

Participants.evidence: Participants were eligible if they had suspected stage IA NSCLC ≤ 2 cm

Intervention.evidence: evaluating the equivalence of sub-lobar resection and lobectomy

Objective.evidence: evaluating the equivalence of sub-lobar resection and lobectomy for stage IA non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival, measured over a 5-year period

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the surgical interventions

Number_Randomised.evidence: From June 15, 2007, to March 22, 2013, 637 patients were preregistered across multiple centers

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 637 preregistered patients, 389 were randomised (61%)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Preoperative biopsy significantly increased randomisation rates (p<0.001)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to randomisation were reported

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial is registered under NCT00499330

Funding.evidence: funded by the National Cancer Institute
